<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_condition_wait:
```c
int metal_condition_wait(struct metal_condition *cv,
				       metal_mutex_t *m)
{
	uintptr_t tmpmptr = 0, mptr = (uintptr_t)m;
	int v = 0;

	/* Check if the mutex has been acquired */
	if (!cv || !m || !metal_mutex_is_acquired(m))
		return -EINVAL;

	if (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&cv->mptr, &tmpmptr, mptr)) {
		if (tmpmptr != mptr)
			return -EINVAL;
	}

	v = atomic_load(&cv->wakeups);
	atomic_fetch_add(&cv->waiters, 1);

	/* Release the mutex before sleeping. */
	metal_mutex_release(m);
	syscall(SYS_futex, &cv->wakeups, FUTEX_WAIT, v, NULL, NULL, 0);
	atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
	/* Acquire the mutex after it's waken up. */
	metal_mutex_acquire(m);

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
v = atomic_load(&cv->wakeups);
atomic_fetch_add(&cv->waiters, 1);

/* Release the mutex before sleeping. */
metal_mutex_release(m);
syscall(SYS_futex, &cv->wakeups, FUTEX_WAIT, v, NULL, NULL, 0);
atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
/* Acquire the mutex after it's waken up. */
metal_mutex_acquire(m);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The code after the futex syscall (atomic_fetch_sub and metal_mutex_acquire) is reachable whenever the syscall returns. There is no unconditional jump, infinite loop or other static control-flow construct that prevents execution of those statements, so Rule 2.1 (no unreachable code) is not violated. (Blocking on futex at runtime does not make the code statically unreachable.)
